programName: Materials Science & Engineering / Nuclear Engineering Joint Major (B.S.)
fullProgramDescription: The Materials Science & Engineering / Nuclear Engineering Joint Major is an interdisciplinary program that combines the study of materials science and nuclear engineering. Students in this program gain a deep understanding of the properties and applications of materials, as well as the principles of nuclear engineering. The program is designed to provide a comprehensive education in the fundamentals of materials science and nuclear engineering, preparing students for careers in a wide range of fields, including energy, aerospace, and biotechnology.
shortProgramDescription: The Materials Science & Engineering / Nuclear Engineering Joint Major provides a comprehensive education in the fundamentals of materials science and nuclear engineering, preparing students for careers in energy, aerospace, and biotechnology.
classHighlights: Students in the program take a range of core courses in materials science and engineering, including thermodynamics, kinetics, and materials characterization.
Courses in nuclear engineering cover topics such as nuclear reactions, radiation transport, and nuclear reactor design.
Additional coursework includes classes in physics, chemistry, and mathematics, providing a strong foundation in the underlying principles of materials science and nuclear engineering.
Students also complete laboratory courses and a senior design project, gaining hands-on experience with materials characterization and nuclear engineering techniques.
The program includes elective courses that allow students to explore specialized topics in materials science and nuclear engineering, such as nanomaterials, biomaterials, and nuclear energy systems.
learningOutcomes: Apply knowledge of materials science and nuclear engineering to solve complex problems.
Understand the properties and applications of a wide range of materials.
Analyze and design nuclear energy systems.
Work effectively in teams to design and implement projects.
Apply mathematical and scientific principles to materials science and nuclear engineering problems.
additionalInformation: Students must complete a senior design project and satisfy all lower-division and upper-division major requirements. The program is administered by the Department of Materials Science & Engineering and the Department of Nuclear Engineering.
